summary: Federal Pell grants help open the door to a college education for millions of low-income students every year. However, students in prison are generally ineligible for the grants. The Department of Education is experimenting with changing that in its Second Chance Pell pilot. Since 2015, 59 schools participating in the pilot have awarded about $35 million in Pell grants to about 8,000 incarcerated students. The...
title: Federal Student Aid: Actions Needed to Evaluate Pell Grant Pilot for Incarcerated Students
